conclusion: An induced current exists only when the magnetic flux through the square loop is changing.
Flux changes while any part of the loop is crossing a field boundary; when the loop is completely outside or completely inside the uniform field, the flux is constant and no current is induced.

premise: The front edge of the loop reaches the left boundary at t = 0.
conclusion: The loop becomes fully immersed when the rear edge has just crossed that boundary.

premise: Distance the loop must move during this stage = its own side length l.
conclusion: Time for this motion = l / v.

premise: The front edge arrives at the right-hand boundary after travelling the field width d; at that instant the loop is still fully inside, so no current.
conclusion: From that instant until the rear edge leaves the field the loop covers again a distance l.

premise: Distance the loop must move during this stage = its own side length l.
conclusion: Time for this stage = l / v.

premise: Time for entering stage = l / v and time for leaving stage = l / v.
conclusion: Total time interval during which the flux is changing (and a current is induced) Î”t = (l / v) + (l / v) = 2l / v.
